CatDescriptText: Mr. Arthur Lynch, sales engineer, Perrysville, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 21, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think students are learning as much under the modern methods of teaching in public schools than students did years ago under the 3 R's (the old teaching method)?" Mr. Arthur Lynch's answer reads: "I had five children under the old system in New York State.  My younger child was under the modern system.  It is my personal observation that they are not getting as much under the modern system as they did under the old.... Considering one phase of study, I don't think the children are getting the relationship of spelling to the sound of the word."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of woman wearing light colored knit sweater, standing on sidewalk in front of store window with sign that reads "Eat Go-Together... Soup'N... Racket"; Portrait of Arthur Lynch with eyes closed wearing fedora, patterned bow tie, and dark coat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
